article.headline: W. Carolina 70, Chattanooga 64
article.story: CULLOWHEE, N.C. (AP) -- Brandon Giles scored 20 points and Western Carolina rode a strong first half to take a 70-64 upset of Chattanooga on Monday night. Eric Wilson scored 13 for the Catamounts (7-15, 3-9 Southern Conference), and Jake Robinson added 10. Stephen McDowell led Chattanooga (14-9, 9-4) with 15 points. Kevin Bridgewaters had 13, and Nicchaeus Doaks added 11. The Mocs trailed 33-19 at halftime, tying a season low for Chattanooga. Stephen McClellan scored eight points during a 10-0 run to draw the Mocs to 38-32 with 15:44 to play. The Mocs cut the gap to 51-50 with 7 minutes left on Bridgewaters' 3-pointer. Giles hit back-to-back 3-pointers to pad the Catamounts' lead. The Mocs got the deficit down to a point three more times, but could never overtake the Catamounts.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
